title: Nigrosene
text: Nigrosene is an outdated <a href="trade%20name">trade name</a> for a black <a href="dye">dye</a> made from oxidised <a href="aniline">aniline</a> <a href="colloid">dispersed</a> in <a href="water">water</a>. It was used as a <a href="colourant">colourant</a> in <a href="shoe%20polish">shoe polish</a> until the 1940s, and as a dark stain for bedplates, brackets, crank handles, and <a href="wood">wood</a>. This name is no longer used in today's trading market.
